chapter.title: Join the LINCS Community and participate in course discussions
chapter.content:
Join the LINCS Community and participate in course discussions

This course is designed for teachers of adult learners with learning disabilities (LD). As with all LINCS courses, this course includes opportunities to connect with other adult education practitioners interested in the field of LD. If you haven’t already done so, take a moment to register as a member of the LINCS Community and participate in the discussions related to this course. The discussions provide an open forum to share your thoughts, ideas, and questions with other adult education practitioners.

At the end of this course, you will have the opportunity to share your ideas and plans as you learn about self-determination in adults with learning disabilities. This is a great opportunity to share and learn from others. We encourage you to participate!

chapter.title: Course objectives
chapter.content:
Course objectives

In this course, we will explore an important attribute associated with successful adult living: self-determination. We will examine factors that promote self-determination, as well as how self-determination can be developed in educational services for individuals with learning disabilities (LD).

Upon completion of this course, you will be able to:

  • explain the importance of self-determination for a person with LD, and describe six factors that affect an individual’s ability to be self-determined; and
  • identify how professionals working with adults with LD can support those adults in developing self-determination to achieve their goals.

_____________

Please allow approximately 1 hour to complete this course. However, you are free to leave the session at any time. When you exit the courseware, a bookmark is automatically placed at your last location to allow you to pick up where you left off when you return.

chapter.content:
Guiding questions

We will address the course objectives by working through two key guiding questions.

Guiding question #1:
What does it mean for an adult with LD to be self-determined?

chapter.title: Definition of self-determination
chapter.content:
Definition of self-determination

Take a moment to review this definition of self-determination. What are some key concepts you see in this definition?

“Self-determination is a combination of skills, knowledge and beliefs that enables a person to engage in goal-directed, self-regulated, autonomous behavior.

An understanding of one's strengths and limitations together with a belief in oneself as capable and effective is essential to self-determination. When acting on the basis of these skills and attitudes, individuals have greater ability to take control of their lives and assume the role of successful adults in our society.” (Field, et. al. 1998)

 

Click the forward arrow to compare your response to ours.

chapter.title: Key concepts in self-determination definition
chapter.content:
Key concepts in self-determination definition

While other answers may apply, some key concepts you may have identified include:

  • skills;
  • knowledge;
  • beliefs;
  • autonomous behaviors; and
  • control.

From this definition we can see that self-determination can be an important factor in a happy and successful adult life.
